result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin D. Fisher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Benjamin D. Fisher is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Benjamin D. Fisher was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber/electronic monitoring granted after first 48 hours.  May be served in Grant County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
2:29 PM Case called - appearances stated. 

Defendant Benjamin D. Fisher in court.  Attorney Lui Moefu in court for Benjamin D. Fisher.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty. Moefu file plea questionnaire waiver of rights form with court at this time - Def. will plead to Ct. 1, OAR Ct. 2 to be dismissed, no agreement as to sentencing.

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court asks defendant for plea. 
Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST
Court accepts the defendants plea and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the defendant guilty. 

State moves to dismiss Ct. 2 
Count 2 DISMISSDED upon motion of the State

Atty Steiner is heard on sentence - PAC .160 requests def. 6 months jail, $1200 fine plus costs, including $120. Blood Test fee (Total $2697) Lifetime revocation will be imposed by DOT
Atty. Moefu states def. is entitled to 2 days jail credit

Atty. Moefu is heard on sentencing - agrees with State's recommendations and requests Court adopt them. Requests Huber, electronic monitoring and possible transfer to Grant Co. and 2 days credit
Comments by Defendant

Court sentences defendant to 240 days in county jail,  1st 48hr without Huber, thereafter Huber is allowed, including electronic monitoring.  Transfer to Grant co. to serve sentence is allowed,
$1200 fine plus court costs, $120.00 Blood Test Fee (total of $2697.00) 
$200/mo. payment plan com. 11/1/2022

Defendant is remanded - Def. entitled to 2 days jail credit, Alcohol Assessment & DSP ordered. $300.00 Bond to be applied

2:30 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Benjamin D. Fisher appeared by phone.  Attorney Lui Moefu appeared by video for Benjamin D. Fisher.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Moefu is heard on the status of the case.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:11 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Benjamin D. Fisher appeared by phone.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lui Moefu appeared by video for Benjamin D. Fisher. 
     Atty. Moefu states Def. waives preliminary hearing; Court reviews waiver with Def.  Def. states understanding.  
     Court makes findings; finds probable cause; binds over for further proceedings.
     Atty. Moefu ready to move forward with arraignment today; waives reading of the Information.  Def stands mute; not guilty plea entered for each of the two counts.
     Atty. Steiner expects test results to be done very soon.  
     Court concludes at 11:20 a.m.
Jury status hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Jury status hearing on August 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:32 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Benjamin D. Fisher appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lui Moefu appeared by video for Benjamin D. Fisher. 

Atty Moefu is heard. Ready to schedule prelim hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 001496,
Payable Number: 70893,
Receipt Number: 22R 001596,
Amount: $20.00

1:57 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Benjamin D. Fisher in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:22 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Benjamin Daniel Fisher appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a $300.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $300.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
